summary: The Expedited Removal Expansion Act of 2025 aims to amend section 235 of the Immigration and Nationality Act. It focuses on treating inadmissible aliens more consistently, regardless of their nationality. Key changes include modifying clauses relating to the inspection of aliens, replacing the Attorney General with the Secretary of Homeland Security in relevant sections, revising the standard of evidence for asylum claims, and expanding the Secretary's discretion in applying expedited removal procedures.
